sn3.7:4.2: Seated to one side, King Pasenadi said to the Buddha:
sn3.7:4.3: “Sir, when I’m sitting in judgement I see propertied aristocrats, brahmins, and householders—rich, affluent, and wealthy, with lots of gold and silver, lots of property and assets, and lots of money and grain. But they tell deliberate lies for the sake of sensual pleasures.
sn3.7:4.5: ‘Enough with passing judgement today. Now my dear will be known by his judgement.’”
sn3.7:5.1: “That’s so true, Great King! That’s so true!
sn3.7:5.2: Those who are propertied aristocrats, brahmins, and householders tell deliberate lies for the sake of sensual pleasures.
sn3.7:5.3: That is for their lasting harm and suffering.”
sn3.7:5.4: This is what the Buddha said. …
sn3.7:6.1: “Full of desire for possessions and pleasures
sn3.7:6.3: they don’t notice that they’ve gone too far,
sn3.7:6.4: like fish entering a net set out.
sn3.7:6.6: for the result will be bad for them.”
